alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 9:33AM CDT until April 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Potent Spring Storm to Bring Heavy Snow and Strong Winds to the Region... .A potent storm system will bring a variety of impactful weather to the region into early Saturday morning. Temperatures across north-central Wisconsin have warmed to around the freezing mark and most of the precipitation has temporarily moved out of the area. With no significant impacts reported, the advisory for this morning has been canceled. Tonight, widespread rain transitions to snow. The snow will be heavy at times, especially along and north of Interstate 90 and 94 where 1 to 2" per hour rates are expected. Currently, the higher amounts from 6 to 9 inches are favored north of U.S. Highway 10 in north-central Wisconsin. Moving south toward Interstate 90, 2 to 6 inch accumulations are expected. The heavier snow may try to push farther south, and there is uncertainty in how quickly rain transitions to snow. Continue to monitor the forecast for updates In addition northwest winds will increase tonight, gusting from 35 to 45 mph. Visibilities will be further reduced in the falling snow, with some drifting mostly in open areas. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Highest snow totals expected from northern Jackson County into Clark County. * WHERE...Clark and Jackson Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
